title: Alternator Cover - Removal

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Caution - Alternator rotor magnets finger injury SM
The rotor magnets are very strong.
When you handle the alternator cover, the magnets may 'grab' the stator and cause injury to the hands or fingers.
When you handle the alternator cover, wear suitable gloves and only grip the alternator cover by the outside surfaces. Always keep your hands and fingers clear when you handle the alternator cover.
Alternator cover removal PB1 PJ1 PJZ
The alternator and crankshaft position sensor share the same harness.
Note the routing of the alternator harness for installation.
Note the routing of the harnesses through the wire guides for installation.
Disconnect the crankshaft position sensor from the main harness and detach it from the wire guide.
Detach the alternator harness from the wire guide.
Note the routing of the harnesses through the wire guide for installation.
Detach the wire guide from the crankcase and route the alternator and crankshaft position sensor harness down to the alternator cover.
Place an oil catch tray beneath the alternator cover to collect any oil that may spill out on removal.
Release the fixings securing the alternator cover in the sequence shown below.
Carefully withdraw the cover. Discard the gasket.
Note the position of the two locating dowels for installation.
Clean the surfaces of the crankcase and the alternator cover using a lint free cloth.
